meanings.sent1: She felt a sense of ease after completing her homework.
meanings.sent2: The cat lounged in the sun with ease.
meanings.sent3: The ease with which he solved the puzzle amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile brought an ease to the tense room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze brought a feeling of ease to the hot day.

meanings.definition: To make less difficult or severe
meanings.sent1: He tried to ease her worries by reassuring her.
meanings.sent2: Using a warm compress can help ease the pain.
meanings.sent3: The kind words eased the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: His apology helped to ease the situation.
meanings.sent5: Adding more water can ease the consistency of the dough.

meanings.definition: To move or act with little effort or difficulty
meanings.sent1: The dancer seemed to ease across the stage effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: He tried to ease into the conversation without drawing attention.
meanings.sent3: The cat eased its way through the narrow opening.
meanings.sent4: The river eased its flow as it reached the flat plains.
meanings.sent5: The car eased down the hill smoothly without any jerking movements.
